Metformin really worked for me.  The first month I was on it we became pg, but I ended up having an ectopic--nothing due to the metformin.  I also took clomid.  After the ectopic, we started follistim injections since my right side was damaged, RE wanted to produce more follicles on the left to get the job done.  I am now pg again and will be 9 weeks Thursday.  All is going very well.  I was also told the metformin would help reduce the risk of a miscarrige.  RE suggests I stay on metformin until 12 weeks or longer if needed.  Hopefully, I will not end up on insilin.  I would also advise you to stay away from carbs when you first start the metformin and when you increase your dosage.  Eating foods with carbs and taking the metformin gave me serious stomach issues.  Taking it with peanut butter helped.  Now that my body is used to the metformin, I try to only eat whole grain carbs, but can stomach regular carbs now. Good luck to you!
